newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT - Oracle cut to hold.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Oracle cut to hold.

text.p: -- UBS Securities said analyst Joseph Farley reduced the rating on Oracle Corp to hold from strong buy.
-- Volume was heavy at 14.2 million shares.
-- The analyst also cut his earnings estimates for the year ending May 1997 to $1.25 per share from $1.30 and for fiscal 1998 to $1.58 from $1.70 per share.
-- "We are unable to apply a degree of certainty to (third quarter) results," Farley wrote in published comments, referring to the quarter ended February 28.

-- He said Oracle's results could be hurt by "ongoing troubles in Europe" and the "possibility of lackluster growth" in the United States, which might otherwise be counted on to produce an upside to overall earnings results.
-- Analyst said Oracle was nearing the "inherent limits in (its) its business model and that its revenues included an increasing contribution from lower margin businessess.
-- Analyst is cautious on his outlook for Oracle's application, database and tool markets.

-- Farley wrote that the June release of the next major release of its core database management system, Oracle 8, heightened the near-term risk to revenues of a product transition making him "even more cautious."
-- While farther out on the horizon, the analyst noted that new releases of Microsoft's SQL Server database system could, in time, challenge Oracle's core business.
-- He said the company's move to target vertical markets like energy and telecommuncations, while a legitimate strategy, ads further risk at a time of other transitions.
